title: Jonah Hill leaves Robert Pattinson's Batman as talks break down
text:
Jonah Hill is out at The Batman (Picture: Getty)

Jonah Hill is no longer in talks to play the villain opposite Robert Pattinson’s The Batman.

The Superbad star had been eyed to play a villain opposite Robert Pattinson in the upcoming Batman reboot, which will be written and directed by Matt Reeves.

However, despite reports that producers have wanted Jonah for the film before they even decided on Pattinson, the deal fell apart and bosses are now looking elsewhere.

Hill is best known for his comedic turns in Superbad, Knocked Up and 21 Jump Street but he was also Oscar-nominated for his role in The Wolf Of Wall Street, starred in dramas including Moneyball and was critically acclaimed for his turn in Netflix’s Maniac.

Plus, he already has some experience with Batman – having voiced the Green Lantern in The Lego Batman Movie.

The Batman is expected to begin in early 2020 (Picture: Rex)

The Batman has not started filming yet, and isn’t expected to begin until early 2020.

Zoe Kravitz is set to enchant our screens as Catwoman with the Big Little Lies actress said to have bagged the role after taking part in a screen test earlier this month.

She fought off stiff competition from the likes of Ana de Armas, Ella Balinska and Eiza Gonzalez, who all reportedly sat down for a table read with Pattinson in early October.

Zoe Kravitz playing Catwoman in The Batman opposite Robert Pattison (Picture: Mega/DC/Getty)

Twilight star Pattinson, 33, has already donned the iconic Batsuit while screen-testing, and it sounds as awesome as we’d expect.

He told Variety: ‘You do feel very powerful immediately. And it’s pretty astonishing, something that is incredibly difficult to get into, so the ritual of getting into it is pretty humiliating.’
